Hymn.Arabic: 9 بِنَفْسِي اشْتَهَيْتُكَ فِي اللَّيْلِ. أَيْضًا بِرُوحِي فِي دَاخِلِي إِلَيْكَ أَبْتَكِرُ. لأَنَّهُ حِينَمَا تَكُونُ أَحْكَامُكَ فِي الأَرْضِ يَتَعَلَّمُ سُكَّانُ الْمَسْكُونَةِ الْعَدْلَ.
Hymn.English: 9 With my soul I have desired You in the night, Yes, by my spirit within me I will seek You early; For when Your judgments [are] in the earth, The inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.

Hymn.Arabic: 10 يُرْحَمُ الْمُنَافِقُ وَلاَ يَتَعَلَّمُ الْعَدْلَ. فِي أَرْضِ الاسْتِقَامَةِ يَصْنَعُ شَرًّا وَلاَ يَرَى جَلاَلَ الرَّبِّ.
Hymn.English: 10 Let grace be shown to the wicked, [Yet] he will not learn righteousness; In the land of uprightness he will deal unjustly, And will not behold the majesty of the LORD.

Hymn.Arabic: 11 يَا رَبُّ، ارْتَفَعَتْ يَدُكَ وَلاَ يَرَوْنَ. يَرَوْنَ وَيَخْزَوْنَ مِنَ الْغَيْرَةِ عَلَى الشَّعْبِ وَتَأْكُلُهُمْ نَارُ أَعْدَائِكَ.
Hymn.English: 11 LORD, [when] Your hand is lifted up, they will not see. But they will see and be ashamed For [their] envy of people; Yes, the fire of Your enemies shall devour them.

Hymn.Arabic: 12 يَا رَبُّ، تَجْعَلُ لَنَا سَلاَمًا لأَنَّكَ كُلَّ أَعْمَالِنَا صَنَعْتَهَا لَنَا.
Hymn.English: 12 LORD, You will establish peace for us, For You have also done all our works in us.

Hymn.Arabic: 13 أَيُّهَا الرَّبُّ إِلهُنَا، قَدِ اسْتَوْلَى عَلَيْنَا سَادَةٌ سِوَاكَ. بِكَ وَحْدَكَ نَذْكُرُ اسْمَكَ.
Hymn.English: 13 O LORD our God, masters besides You Have had dominion over us; [But] by You only we make mention of Your name.

Hymn.Arabic: 14 هُمْ أَمْوَاتٌ لاَ يَحْيَوْنَ. أَخْيِلَةٌ لاَ تَقُومُ. لِذلِكَ عَاقَبْتَ وَأَهْلَكْتَهُمْ وَأَبَدْتَ كُلَّ ذِكْرِهِمْ.
Hymn.English: 14 [They are] dead, they will not live; [They are] deceased, they will not rise. Therefore You have punished and destroyed them, And made all their memory to perish.

Hymn.Arabic: 15 زِدْتَ الأُمَّةَ يَا رَبُّ، زِدْتَ الأُمَّةَ. تَمَجَّدْتَ. وَسَّعْتَ كُلَّ أَطْرَافِ الأَرْضِ.
Hymn.English: 15 You have increased the nation, O LORD, You have increased the nation; You are glorified; You have expanded all the borders of the land.

Hymn.Arabic: 16 يَا رَبُّ فِي الضِّيقِ طَلَبُوكَ. سَكَبُوا مُخَافَتَةً عِنْدَ تَأْدِيبِكَ إِيَّاهُمْ.
Hymn.English: 16 LORD, in trouble they have visited You, They poured out a prayer [when] Your chastening [was] upon them.

Hymn.Arabic: 17 كَمَا أَنَّ الْحُبْلَى الَّتِي تُقَارِبُ الْوِلاَدَةَ تَتَلَوَّى وَتَصْرُخُ فِي مَخَاضِهَا، هكَذَا كُنَّا قُدَّامَكَ يَا رَبُّ.
Hymn.English: 17 As a woman with child Is in pain and cries out in her pangs, When she draws near the time of her delivery, So have we been in Your sight, O LORD.

Hymn.Arabic: 18 حَبِلْنَا تَلَوَّيْنَا كَأَنَّنَا وَلَدْنَا رِيحًا. لَمْ نَصْنَعْ خَلاَصًا فِي الأَرْضِ، وَلَمْ يَسْقُطْ سُكَّانُ الْمَسْكُونَةِ.
Hymn.English: 18 We have been with child, we have been in pain; We have, as it were, brought forth wind; We have not accomplished any deliverance in the earth, Nor have the inhabitants of the world fallen.

Hymn.Arabic: 19 تَحْيَا أَمْوَاتُكَ، تَقُومُ الْجُثَثُ. اسْتَيْقِظُوا، تَرَنَّمُوا يَا سُكَّانَ التُّرَابِ. لأَنَّ طَلَّكَ طَلُّ أَعْشَابٍ، وَالأَرْضُ تُسْقِطُ الأَخْيِلَةَ.
Hymn.English: 19 Your dead shall live; [Together with] my dead body they shall arise. Awake and sing, you who dwell in dust; For your dew [is like] the dew of herbs, And the earth shall cast out the dead.

Hymn.Arabic: 20 هَلُمَّ يَا شَعْبِي ادْخُلْ مَخَادِعَكَ، وَأَغْلِقْ أَبْوَابَكَ خَلْفَكَ. اخْتَبِئْ نَحْوَ لُحَيْظَةٍ حَتَّى يَعْبُرَ الْغَضَبُ.
Hymn.English: 20 Come, my people, enter your chambers, And shut your doors behind you; Hide yourself, as it were, for a little moment, Until the indignation is past.
Praise be to God forever. Amen.
